howToPlay.intro: Follow the lotus flower animation to guide your 4-7-8 breathing pattern:
howToPlay.step1: The 4-7-8 pattern: INHALE 4 seconds, HOLD 7 seconds, EXHALE 8 seconds.
howToPlay.step2: INHALE through your nose for 4 seconds as the lotus opens.
howToPlay.step3: HOLD your breath for 7 seconds as the lotus pauses fully open.
howToPlay.step4: EXHALE slowly for 8 seconds as the lotus closes. Repeat for 4-8 cycles.
howToPlay.tip: Practice 4-7-8 breathing in bed before sleep. The long exhale activates your parasympathetic nervous system, making it one of the most effective natural sleep aids.

science.title: The Science Behind 4-7-8 Breathing
science.description: Developed by Dr. Andrew Weil, the 4-7-8 technique leverages the power of extended exhalation to activate the parasympathetic nervous system. The prolonged exhale (8 seconds) stimulates the vagus nerve more strongly than the inhale, creating a net calming effect. The 7-second hold allows oxygen to saturate the bloodstream more fully while increasing CO2 tolerance. Clinical studies show it can reduce the time to fall asleep by up to 50%.

whatIs.question: What is 4-7-8 breathing?
whatIs.answer: 4-7-8 breathing is a technique developed by Dr. Andrew Weil. You inhale through your nose for 4 seconds, hold your breath for 7 seconds, and exhale through your mouth for 8 seconds. The extended exhale triggers a deep relaxation response.

howLong.question: How many cycles of 4-7-8 breathing should I do?
howLong.answer: Dr. Weil recommends starting with 4 cycles and working up to 8 cycles. A single cycle takes about 19 seconds, so 4 cycles take about 76 seconds. Even this short practice can produce significant calming effects.

optimal.question: Can 4-7-8 breathing help me sleep?
optimal.answer: Yes! 4-7-8 breathing is one of the most effective natural sleep aids. The long exhale activates the parasympathetic nervous system, slowing your heart rate and preparing your body for sleep. Many people fall asleep within 2-3 rounds of practice.

benefits.question: How is 4-7-8 breathing different from Box Breathing?
benefits.answer: Box Breathing uses equal 4-4-4-4 timing and is best for alertness and focus under stress. 4-7-8 breathing uses asymmetric timing with a longer hold and exhale, making it better for relaxation and sleep. Both are on this site — try both to see which works for you.
